definition: to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: Do you like reading classics or popular novels?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢阅读古典作品还是通俗小说？

sentences.english: The popular fiction displays the unique and broad conveyance of nativeness.
sentences.chinese: 这些通俗小说中蕴含了独特而广泛的本土传递。

sentences.english: Soap opera is for TV what the popular novel is for books.
sentences.chinese: 肥皂剧之于电视，犹如通俗小说之于书籍。

sentences.english: Alexandre Dumas is one of the best popular historical novelists in France.
sentences.chinese: 大仲马是法国著名的历史通俗小说家。

sentences.english: Sanyan and Erpai was representative of popular novels.
sentences.chinese: 三言二拍便是这类通俗小说的代表。

definition: novel in chapters, main format for long novels from the Ming onwards, with each chapter headed by a summary couplet
Jinpingmei or the Golden Lotus (1617), Ming dynasty vernacular novel, formerly notorious and banned for its sexual content
Mandarin ducks and butterfly (i.e. love birds) literary school around 1900, criticized as populist and romantic by socialist realists
supernatural novel/novel of ghosts and goblins
reference book consisting of material quoted from many sources, arranged by category (about 600 of which were compiled between the 3rd and 18th centuries in China)
